text: now some breaking news in the past hour
or so Sudan has said it will hand over
the former President Omar al-bashir to
the International Criminal Court now
he's wanted for war crimes and crimes
against humanity this appears to have
come about as a result of an agreement
between the new government and rebel
groups in Darfur a membership deposed
last April the first sitting president
to be indicted by the ICC at the moment
the ICC says it cannot confirm that
announcement thus if we can get some
clarity on this with that and soy who
joins us from Nairobi I mean we know
this is for sure do we and if so I mean
this is a significant development it is
a huge development for Sudan and for the
people of Darfur the announcement was
made in the morning by the spokesperson
of the transitional military council
basically the council that he's
currently running Sudan he was in Juba
when he made that announcement saying
that he had reached that agreement and
they would be handing over Omar
al-bashir to the International Criminal
Court now it's been a long time coming
Omar al-bashir was indicted for war
crimes and crimes against humanity
including genocide in the Darfur crimes
that were committed between 2003 and
around 2010 there were two arrest
warrants against him by the
International Criminal Court issued in
2009 and 2010 but were largely ignored
he continued to travel across Africa and
the Middle East countries that are
members of the ICC did not hand him over
in some cases the government's were
taken to courts and to their local
courts in their countries but still
until now there hasn't been any
willingness to hand him over to the ICC
and that's why this is a major
development and when could this happen
we do not know yet at home Omar
al-bashir has already appeared before
court he was convicted in December and
for corruption at home and so he is in
government hands at the moment so we'll
wait to hear from them for the clarity
and whether the transitional military
council will be
speaking in one voice in the past few
days there's been controversy in the
country after the head of the
transitional military council held a
meeting with the Israel leader and that
has brought a lot of discontent in Sudan
so it will be interesting to see whether
this announcement will be backed by all
members of the transitional council okay
and with very latest in Nairobi thank
you very much
